text: this is CJ Chivers reporting from this
rock Olivia the military forces in
Misrata were fighting for Colonel
Muammar al-gaddafi have been firing into
the city with a range of heavy weapons
some of which are indiscriminate these
include gravity ground rockets that are
landing in civilian neighborhoods and
for the first time we've identified that
they're also using cluster munitions
upon arriving in Misrata last night one
of these expended munitions was in the
hospital and one of the hospital
employees show that the Bryan Denton
who's our photographer here and he
brought it to me and we made a tentative
ID last night and then overnight through
some sources in the munitions community
were able to get specific identification
Azamat 120 which were manufactured in
Spain and then this morning after we had
the identification we went down to a
civilian neighborhood that was hit by
grounding rod rocket strikes yesterday
and made a survey of the areas were
bouncing landed they all landed in a
clearly a civilian areas there's no
military infrastructure nearby then the
residence yesterday had reported the 23
people were killed in these strikes we
know that 11 of them are in the morgue
at the hospital we were able to find
eight more today when some of the local
people took us to the graves of eight
people were killed while standing at a
breadline classroom bombs one-sided into
civilian areas like this or
fundamentally indiscriminate weapon
there is a convention on cluster
munitions that more than 100 countries
have signed essentially a tree rally not
to use these types of weapons and many
countries have destroyed their existing
stocks Libya is not one of the signatory
that treaty nor is the United States
which has used cluster munitions in both
Afghanistan and Iraq in this case the
weapons are particularly worrisome
because they're being used in
neighborhoods that are essentially
surrounded by Qaddafi troops and
civilians don't have any real means of
escaping
you
